text: what is more comforting than a warm
apple crisp on a cool fall day this
apple crisp recipe is one of my
favorites it's super simple
delicious and is vegan so I have 2
pounds of granny smith apples here I
like to use a tart variety because I
find that it adds just a nice sort of
brightness to the rich crumbly topping
so let's get started on the topping this
crisp is not only vegan it's also gluten
free if you use gluten free rolled oats
start with 1 cup of old-fashioned rolled
oats and we're just gonna make a
homemade oat flour so grind it in a food
processor until it's pretty powdery
all right that looks great so into a
large bowl one cup ground oats to that
add another cup of rolled oats but these
are the whole ones this is gonna add a
nice textural contrast you've got the
chew from the whole guys you've also got
the flavour of the ground ones it's one
happy oat family I have half a cup of
light brown sugar 1/4 teaspoon of kosher
salt this is really important to help
balance the flavors and my favorite part
of this crisp this is six tablespoons of
extra virgin coconut oil this is our
stand-in for butter which is usually
pretty traditional in crisp recipes to
that add two tablespoons of water
the reason I'm adding a little bit of
water here is that I want to make sure
all the oats are properly moistened I
don't want to add any more fat there's a
plenty good amount of coconut oil here
just need a little extra moisture if
you're interested in swapping out more
traditional baked goods with coconut oil
would mean just taking out the butter so
when you're looking for coconut oil if
you're baking or cooking look for extra
virgin coconut oil because that oil has
been processed less so it retains more
of its natural nutrients and minerals a
good indicator that it is high processed
or refined is that it won't smell like
coconut at all they'll have a really
neutral flavor
okay so let's assemble I have an 8-inch
pan here I've just very lightly coated
it with a little coconut oil you finish
up with my filling before we get ahead
of ourselves this is the two pounds of
granny smith apples to that add a
quarter cup of light brown sugar quarter
teaspoon of ground cinnamon that's part
of what gives an apple crisp its
signature smell and then I have a
quarter cup of dried cherries this is
going to add a nice amount of chew
little tart hit
as the apples bake and steam they'll
sort of plump the cherries which makes
them just have a really really wonderful
texture also a great way to incorporate
cherries when it's not fresh cherry
season so make sure this is thoroughly
thoroughly tossed all right this looks
great so into the prepared pan it goes
now we'll add any topping so just sort
of sprinkle it evenly here this will
crisp up really really nicely in the
oven okay this looks great I'm gonna
bake this at 375 degrees
we're gonna go half on half off with a
parchment lined foil cover apples take a
second to cook so we want to make sure
that they sort of steam in the first
section so wrap this tightly all right
so into the oven 375 covered for 30
minutes uncovered for 30 minutes until
it's golden and
this is bake for about an hour let's
give it a try looks great and hear that
crisp topping right not called an apple
crisp for nothing oh that's so lovely
love the caramelized bits there hmm
Oh YUM this is so delicious exactly what
you want to eat on a cool day you really
taste the coconut oil here it's an
excellent way to update a comfort
classic if you want more healthy dessert
